text: I have that case for my desktop and I really like it! Nice design with plenty of room but still a little smaller than many cases (which I generally find to be obnoxiously large)

elements.text: I have that case for my desktop and I really like it! Nice design with plenty of room but still a little smaller than many cases (which I generally find to be obnoxiously large)

text: I have an Ncase M1 which is small by normal standards but pretty big by SFF standards, I generally love it but if I built another PC I would go smaller. I also have a NUC-style mini PC which I very slightly regret buying, as the fans come on a lot and they're louder than I feel they should be.

text: I have a bitfenix shinobi and a noctua cooler and I really like the fact that I cant even hear the computer running

text:
Chris I am with you on that, something about tiny efficient devices satisfies my OCD tendancies. I was looking at mini-itx's and Nuc's, and even SBC's. What I've decided is, wait 5 yrs for an SBC to be a desktop I can dev on, cost difference between a mini-itx and a NUC seems to lean toward itx, but size difference is all about the NUC it seems.

I have a microatx board in an old box, with a GPU. The case got nasty over time, and honestly, it was cheap and cruddy anyways. So to breathe some life into the hardware I'm looking at getting a case that I can put this back into, and then slowly do upgrades

elements.text:
Chris I am with you on that, something about tiny efficient devices satisfies my OCD tendancies. I was looking at mini-itx's and Nuc's, and even SBC's. What I've decided is, wait 5 yrs for an SBC to be a desktop I can dev on, cost difference between a mini-itx and a NUC seems to lean toward itx, but size difference is all about the NUC it seems.

I have a microatx board in an old box, with a GPU. The case got nasty over time, and honestly, it was cheap and cruddy anyways. So to breathe some life into the hardware I'm looking at getting a case that I can put this back into, and then slowly do upgrades
